request.description:
Waiter accepts specific order items via API Gateway (multi-tenant route).

**Item-Centric Architecture:**
- Accept specific items by IDs (granular control)
- Can accept item A while rejecting item B
- Route: POST /tenants/:tenantId/orders/:orderId/accept-items
- API Gateway proxies to Order Service

**Request Body:**
- itemIds: Array of item UUIDs to accept
- waiterId: UUID of waiter accepting items

**Response:**
- Updated order with accepted items
- Kitchen receives notification for accepted items

Waiter rejects specific order items with a reason via API Gateway (multi-tenant route).

**Item-Centric Architecture:**
- Reject specific items by IDs
- Must provide rejection reason (min 5 characters)
- Route: POST /tenants/:tenantId/orders/:orderId/reject-items
- API Gateway proxies to Order Service

**Request Body:**
- itemIds: Array of item UUIDs to reject
- waiterId: UUID of waiter rejecting items
- rejectionReason: Reason for rejection (required, min 5 chars)

**Response:**
- Updated order with rejected items
- Customer receives notification with rejection reason

Get list of pending notifications for waiter dashboard via API Gateway (multi-tenant route).

**Pure Alert Layer:**
- Returns UNREAD and READ notifications (excludes ARCHIVED)
- Ordered by priority DESC, createdAt ASC
- Route: GET /tenants/:tenantId/waiter/notifications
- API Gateway proxies to Waiter Service (RabbitMQ)

**Query Parameters:**
- waiterId: (Optional) Filter by specific waiter
- tableId: (Optional) Filter by specific table
- page: Page number (default: 1)
- limit: Items per page (default: 10)

**Response:**
- notifications: Array of notification objects
- total: Total notification count
- page: Current page
- limit: Items per page
- totalPages: Total pages

Mark notification as read when waiter views it via API Gateway (multi-tenant route).

**UI State Tracking:**
- Changes status from UNREAD → READ
- Records readAt timestamp
- Route: POST /tenants/:tenantId/waiter/notifications/:notificationId/read
- API Gateway proxies to Waiter Service (RabbitMQ)
- Pure notification layer (no business logic)

**Request Body:**
- waiterId: UUID of waiter viewing notification

**Response:**
- Updated notification object with READ status and readAt timestamp

Archive notification (dismiss or order completed) via API Gateway (multi-tenant route).

**UI State:**
- Changes status to ARCHIVED
- Removes from pending notifications list
- Route: POST /tenants/:tenantId/waiter/notifications/:notificationId/archive
- API Gateway proxies to Waiter Service (RabbitMQ)
- Can be used when waiter dismisses alert or order is completed

**Response:**
- Success confirmation
